title: David’s Final Preparations and Solomon’s Ascension
shortSummary: 1 Chronicles 29 records King David’s final preparations for the temple, including his generous offerings and prayers, and the people’s willing contributions. The chapter concludes with Solomon’s anointing as king and David’s death, highlighting God’s sovereign hand over Israel’s leadership and the importance of wholehearted worship and obedience.
timeline: c. 970 BC - End of David’s reign and Solomon’s rise to the throne

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The king of Israel who prepares extensively for the temple and offers a heartfelt prayer of dedication before passing the throne to Solomon.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: David’s son, chosen by God to build the temple and succeed David as king of Israel.

keyCharacters.name: Jehiel the Gershonite
keyCharacters.description: The official entrusted with receiving the precious stones offered for the temple treasury.

keyCharacters.name: Zadok
keyCharacters.description: The priest anointed alongside Solomon, serving as a spiritual leader during Solomon’s reign.

outline.heading: David’s Preparations and Call for Offerings
outline.description: David acknowledges Solomon’s youth and God’s choice of him, then details his own extensive preparations for the temple. He calls the leaders and people to willingly contribute, resulting in joyful and generous offerings for God’s house.

outline.heading: David’s Prayer of Praise and Dedication
outline.description: David blesses and praises God for His greatness and sovereignty, humbly recognizing that all things come from Him. He prays for the people’s continued devotion and for Solomon to have a perfect heart to obey God’s commandments.

outline.heading: The People’s Worship and Solomon’s Anointing
outline.description: The congregation blesses the Lord, worships Him, and offers abundant sacrifices. Solomon is anointed king and established as the ruler, with God granting him unprecedented majesty and favor.

outline.heading: Summary of David’s Reign and Death
outline.description: The chapter closes with a summary of David’s forty-year reign, his prosperous life, and his death. It also references the written records of his acts and reign by the prophets Samuel, Nathan, and Gad.

application: Give generously and willingly to God’s work, recognizing that all we have is from Him and should be used for His glory.
Cultivate a heart of humility and dependence on God, acknowledging that our strength and success come from His hand.
Pray earnestly for God to give leaders and ourselves a heart fully committed to obeying His commandments.
Celebrate and participate in corporate worship and dedication, rejoicing in God’s provision and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee, and of thine own have we given thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the biblical principle of stewardship and humility, recognizing God as the ultimate source of all blessings.

keyVerses.text: I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.
keyVerses.significance: David’s prayer emphasizes God’s examination of the heart and the importance of willing, sincere offerings in worship.

keyVerses.text: And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped the LORD, and the king.
keyVerses.significance: This verse marks the public affirmation of God’s kingship and Solomon’s legitimate succession, underscoring the unity of worship and leadership.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
keyVerses.significance: God’s sovereign blessing on Solomon’s reign demonstrates divine approval and the fulfillment of His promises to David’s lineage.
